column4: hum. i'm trying to add a user to a group with "sudo usermod -G video pow", but the user is not added to the group :/
e.g. grep pow /etc/group after that command gives nothing :/
sudo adduser elvstone video
sudo adduser pow video
but the login already exists, i'd like to modify it.
i used useradd -m -s /bin/bash pow to add it btw..
sudo adduser pow video   adds the existing pow to the group
useradd is, um, old?
oh. okay. why doesn't usermod -G work? it usually does..
it's standard isn't it?
adduser/deluser has been standard in debian for years now
alright, sorry, coming from BSD :)
thanks!
np, many similarities, and a few gotchas, heh
hm. it's still not added, sudo adduser pow video && grep pow /etc/group yields nothing :/
okay, first off, your user has sudo permissions, right?
yep. i'm using my regular login 'elvstone'.
and it has sudo permission (i use it all the time).
sudo vigr should work, but the other should have as well
alright. i'll try with vigr.
i don't normally recommend vi-ish things, but you're from bsd :)
oops, sorry. did the sudo adduser in the wrong VT the first time :)
worked fine now.
glad to hear there was a sensible explanation :)
